p: Twenty-six TDR-TCs originated in the last five years for subtype B (active clusters; Table 1 and Table A in S1 File). This population was similar to the population involved in subtype B active clusters: male (85%, 64/75), living in Lisboa and Vale do Tejo region and <35 years old (both 65.3%). Twenty-four TDR-TCs had evidence of onward transmission of SDRMs, those were mainly thymidine analog mutations (TAMs) and/or NNRTIs SDRMs. Seven out of those 24 TDR-TCs with evidence of onward transmission were still active in the last five years. The characteristics of the population reflected that male (77%, 20/26) and living Lisboa and Vale do Tejo region (69.2%) still drive the transmission of TDR.
